result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L Sauthoff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs due during period of supervision.
Pay supervision fees.
   Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.
Court recommends placement in Dual Diagnosis Program

Defendant Robert L Sauthoff in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Defendant in custody. Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing recommendation by the State. Response by Atty Sachs. Court renders sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Robert L Sauthoff in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Defendant in custody. Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def has revocation case in br 3 and requests to consolidate to br 3 for sentencing. Plea of guilty entered.   Court accepts plea, finds the defendant guilty. State will recommend: 3 yrs total; 1 1/2 yrs confinement, 1 1/2 yrs extended supervision consecutive to any sentence. Defense free to argue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on July 23, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

May request to resolve in another branch with sentencing after revocation case.  Further proceedings scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Robert L Sauthoff in court with attorney Richard A Sachs.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing waived. Preliminary hearing on May 6, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Robert L Sauthoff in court with attorney Richard A Sachs.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant and/or counsel requests matter be scheduled for preliminary hearing.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Conditions set by court:  No use or possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and in original containers.

Defendant Robert L Sauthoff in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail.  Waive reading of felony complaint. Defendant does qualify for public defender, but will be reassigned.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint.  Court orders adjournment, allowing time for defendant to decide whether preliminary hearing will be requested.  Court finds good cause to extend time limits for holding preliminary hearing.  Status conference scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
